PARAGRAPH.STRING: (born June 18, 1966) is a prominent Canadian figure skater
was extremely popular during the late 1980s and 1990s.
was born in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta and raised in Caroline, Alberta.
married Sonia Rodriguez, a principal dancer with the National Ballet of Canada, on June 30, 1996. Their son Gabriel was born on July 12, 2003.
was a four-time Canadian figure skating champion and four-time World Champion.
represented Canada in three Winter Olympics, 1988 (finishing 8th overall), 1992 (6th) and 1994 (5th), and
was given the privilege of carrying the Canadian flag during the opening ceremonies of the 1994 games in Lillehammer, Norway.

other achievements are numerous, including three Canadian Professional Championships, three World Professional Championships, a Lou Marsh Award for top Canadian Athlete (in 1990), Lionel Conacher Award winner (1990 and 1991), Order of Canada recipient (in 1990), an American Skating World Professional Skater of the Year Award (in 1998), and a Gustav Lussi Award from the Professional Skaters' Association (in 2001).
On March 25, 1988, at the 1988 World Championships in Budapest, Hungary,
landed the first quadruple jump ever in competition. This accomplishment is listed in the Guinness Book of Records.
was inducted into Canada's Sports Hall of Fame in 1994 and Canada's Figure Skating Hall of Fame in 2000.
was honoured with a star on Fame in 2001.
also appeared in the 2006 FOX television program Skating with Celebrities.
